topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack® Carrier Grade (Alpha): Creating a Snapshot from a Volume

titlealts.searchtitle: HP Helion OpenStack® Carrier Grade (Alpha): Creating an Instance Snapshot

body.p: A snapshot is a new image based on a running instance. That snapshot can be used as the base for new instances.

section.title: Creating a snapshot

li.p: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Helion Dashboard.
Click the Compute tab on the dashboard Project panel.
In the Compute panel, click Volumes.
In the Volumes screen, for the volume you want to create a snapshot, click the arrow icon in the Actions menu and select Create Snapshot.
On the Create Snapshot tab, enter a name for the snapshot.
Click Create Snapshot to launch the instance.
A snapshot image is created on the Volume Snapshot tab.

section.p: When you create a snapshot, by default the snapshot image can be used only with the current project.
You can make the snapshot public for use in all projects in the domain and you can protect the image from being deleted.
